paper_abstract: Elections are a central model in a variety of areas. This paper studies parameterized computational complexity of five control problems in the Maximin election. We obtain the following results: constructive control by adding candidates is W[2]-hard with respect to the parameter "number of added candidates"; both constructive and destructive control by adding/deleting voters are W[1]-hard with respect to the parameter "number of added/deleted voters". (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Parameterized complexity of control problems in Maximin election
